   Louis Jacobson
   By Louis Jacobson June 1, 2010

Obama blames 30-day legal limit for role in oil spill

   As anger grows over the massive, uncontained oil spill in the Gulf of
   Mexico, the procedure for issuing federal drilling permits for the Gulf
   Coast has begun to attract intense scrutiny.

"One example, under
   current law, the Interior Department has only 30 days to review an
   exploration plan submitted by an oil company.

"Changing this
   30-day mandatory deadline to a 90-day timeline that can be further
   extended to complete environmental and safety reviews, as needed, would
   provide MMS more time to conduct additional environmental analysis on an
   exploration plan," the department said in its announcement.
